metachat.tl.communication_responseGenes

metachat.tl.communication_responseGenes(adata, adata_raw, database_name=None, metabolite_name=None, metapathway_name=None, customerlist_name=None, summary='receiver', n_var_genes=None, var_genes=None, n_deg_genes=None, nknots=6, n_points=50, deg_pvalue_cutoff=0.05)[source]

Function for identifying signals dependent genes

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – adata.AnnData object after running inference function mc.tl.metabolic_communication.

  • adata_raw (AnnData) – adata.AnnData object with raw spatial transcriptome data.

  • database_name (Optional[str]) – Name of the Metabolite-Sensor interaction database.

  • metabolite_name (Optional[str]) – Name of a specific metabolite to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‘HMDB0000148’.

  • metapathway_name (Optional[str]) – Name of a specific metabolic pathways to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‘Alanine, aspartate and glutamate metabolism’.

  • customerlist_name (Optional[str]) – Name of a specific customerlist to detect response genes. For example, customerlist_name = ‘CustomerA’.

  • summary (str) – ‘sender’ or ‘receiver’

  • n_var_genes (Optional[int]) – The number of most variable genes to test.

  • var_genes – The genes to test. n_var_genes will be ignored if given.

  • n_deg_genes (Optional[int]) – The number of top deg genes to evaluate yhat.

  • nknots (int) – Number of knots in spline when constructing GAM.

  • n_points (int) – Number of points on which to evaluate the fitted GAM for downstream clustering and visualization.

  • deg_pvalue_cutoff (float) – The p-value cutoff of genes for obtaining the fitted gene expression patterns.

Returns:

  • df_deg (pd.DataFrame) – A data frame of deg analysis results, including Wald statistics, degree of freedom, and p-value.

  • df_yhat (pd.DataFrame) – A data frame of smoothed gene expression values.
